Fermi Paradox: If intelligent life is likely, why haven't we found any sign of it?
Theory of Relativity: Time and space are relative, created by Albert Einstein.
Black holes are not holes, but rather regions of extremely curved space-time.
Light cannot escape from a black hole due to its intense gravity.
White holes are theoretically the opposite of black holes, expelling matter and light.
Did you know that nothing exceeds the speed of light? It is the universal limit.
The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792,458 meters per second.
Nothing can travel faster than light, not even information.
Did you know that light takes about 8 minutes and 20 seconds to travel from the Sun to the Earth?
Light is a form of electromagnetic radiation visible to the human eye.
White light is composed of several colors, which can be separated by a prism.
Did you know that light can behave both as a wave and as a particle?
Light is a form of energy that propagates in waves.
Light can be reflected, refracted, and absorbed by different materials.
Did you know that light can be split into its color spectrum using a prism?
Light is a fundamental part of our understanding of the universe.
Light is essential for life on Earth, allowing photosynthesis in plants.

Did you know that the highest mountain in the solar system is Olympus Mons on Mars?
Did you know that Mars has the largest canyon in the solar system, called Valles Marineris?
Did you know that Mars has two moons called Phobos and Deimos?
Did you know that Mars is the planet most similar to Earth in our solar system?

It is not known whether the universe is infinite or finite.
We do not know exactly how old the universe is, but estimates suggest about 13.8 billion years.
The universe has been expanding since the Big Bang, and this expansion is accelerating.
Question: What will be the end of the universe?
The universe is composed mainly of dark matter and dark energy, which we cannot see directly.
The starlight we see today may have traveled for millions or billions of years before reaching us.
The cosmic microwave background radiation is evidence of the Big Bang.
Most of the mass of the universe is in the form of dark matter, which does not emit detectable light or radiation.
Dark energy is a mysterious form of energy that is causing the acceleration of the universe's expansion.
The universe may have multiple dimensions beyond the three we can perceive.
String theory suggests that the fundamental particles of the universe are actually tiny vibrating strings.
Gravity is the force that keeps the planets in orbit around the Sun and the galaxies together.
